intro: Gymnocalycium hossei subsp. ferrarii, commonly known as the Ferrari's moon cactus, is a succulent cactus native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its globular, spiny stems and produces yellow to orange flowers during the warmer months. The plant has a thick, fleshy stem that stores water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. It is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation due to its compact size and ornamental appearance. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic differences from the main species.
